pull.title: contrib: use c++ compiler rather than c compiler for binary checks
pull.body:
From hebasto's CMake repo. See discussion here: https://github.com/hebasto/bitcoin/pull/252#discussion_r1664657488

Use CXX/CXXFLAGS rather than CC/CFLAGS to test our actual compiler for binary checks rather than the one we only forward to secp256k1.

events.body:
<!--e57a25ab6845829454e8d69fc972939a-->

The following sections might be updated with supplementary metadata relevant to reviewers and maintainers.

<!--006a51241073e994b41acfe9ec718e94-->
### Code Coverage
For detailed information about the code coverage, see the [test coverage report](https://corecheck.dev/bitcoin/bitcoin/pulls/30387).
<!--021abf342d371248e50ceaed478a90ca-->
### Reviews
See [the guideline](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#code-review) for information on the review process.
| Type | Reviewers |
| ---- | --------- |
| Concept ACK | [fanquake](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/30387#issuecomment-2208993921) |
| Stale ACK | [hebasto](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/30387#pullrequestreview-2158920731) |

If your review is incorrectly listed, please react with ðŸ‘Ž to this comment and the bot will ignore it on the next update.
<!--174a7506f384e20aa4161008e828411d-->
### Conflicts
Reviewers, this pull request conflicts with the following ones:

* [#30423](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/30423) (contrib: simplify `test-security-check` by fanquake)
* [#27038](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/27038) (security-check: test for `_FORTIFY_SOURCE` usage in release binaries by fanquake)

If you consider this pull request important, please also help to review the conflicting pull requests. Ideally, start with the one that should be merged first.

> Use CXX/CXXFLAGS rather than CC/CFLAGS to test our actual compiler for binary checks rather than the one we only forward to secp256k1.

Concept ACK on that.

> From hebasto's CMake repo. See discussion here: [hebasto#252 (comment)](https://github.com/hebasto/bitcoin/pull/252#discussion_r1664657488)

While the discussion was raised in the CMake project, I'd like to note that this change is _not required_ for it. However, the CMake project's implementation depends on this PR.

ACK 98ff3703b81fbcece22eed55433cfe0fe101704f, I have reviewed the code and it looks OK. The Guix build script works as expected..

events.message:
contrib: use c++ rather than c for binary tests

We don't actually use a c compiler as part of Core's build (only for secp).
We should be testing against what we're actually using instead.
contrib: rename cc to cxx in binary checking scripts

events.body:
Getting a check failure during a guix build:
```
.
----------------------------------------------------------------------
Ran 1 test in 5.525s

OK
F
======================================================================
FAIL: test_ELF (__main__.TestSymbolChecks)
----------------------------------------------------------------------
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/distsrc-base/distsrc-dae34eb480c8-arm-linux-gnueabihf/./contrib/devtools/test-symbol-check.py", line 69, in test_ELF
    self.assertEqual(call_symbol_check(cxx, source, executable, []),
AssertionError: Tuples differ: (1, 'test3: export of symbol __cxa_begin_c[216 chars]OLS') != (0, '')

First differing element 0:
1
0

+ (0, '')
- (1,
-  'test3: export of symbol __cxa_begin_cleanup not allowed!\n'
-  'test3: export of symbol __cxa_call_unexpected not allowed!\n'
-  'test3: export of symbol __aeabi_atexit not allowed!\n'
-  'test3: export of symbol __cxa_type_match not allowed!\n'
-  'test3: failed EXPORTED_SYMBOLS')

----------------------------------------------------------------------
Ran 1 test in 1.004s

FAILED (failures=1)
make: *** [Makefile:1351: test-security-check] Error 1
```

> Getting a check failure during a guix build:

I think we should avoid `#include <iostream>` in our test stubs, [which](https://en.cppreference.com/w/cpp/header/iostream)
> behaves as if it defines a static storage duration object...

events.message: contrib: c++ify test stubs after switching to c++ compilers

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -334,14 +334,14 @@ clean-local: clean-docs

 if TARGET_DARWIN
-	$(AM_V_at) CC='$(CC)' CFLAGS='$(CFLAGS)' CPPFLAGS='$(CPPFLAGS)' LDFLAGS='$(LDFLAGS)' $(PYTHON) $(top_srcdir)/contrib/devtools/test-security-check.py TestSecurityChecks.test_MACHO
